title: Fish Tacos With Salsa Verde And Radish Salad
summary: Fish Tacos With Salsa Verde And Radish Salad might be just the Mexican recipe you are searching for. This main course has 438 calories, 39g of protein, and 16g of fat per serving. This gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian recipe serves 4 and costs $3.81 per serving. 52 people were impressed by this recipe. Head to the store and pick up coarse salt and ground pepper, lime juice, jalapeno chile, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the lime juice you could follow this main course with the Lime Angel Food Cake with Lime Glaze and Pistachios as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 97%. This score is spectacular. Try Fish Tacos With Salsa Verde And Radish Salad, Fish Tacos with Mango Salsa Verde, and Radish confetti with salsa verde for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. You could try Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Straw yellow hue, accompanied by a close-focused nose of pear, apricot and white flowers. The fruity palate, with top notes of stone fruit, shows ripeness and roundness well supported by an elegant acidity and savoriness, ensuring a long, lingering finish.
